How could I possibly raise a confident, capable child when I'd been so broken myself?

And don't even get me started on the principal - he's always talking about "raising standards" and "increasing accountability," but what does that really mean? Just more stress and pressure for us parents, trying to keep up with his expectations.

I've tried everything to help my daughter succeed - extra tutoring, after-school programs, even taking her to therapy sessions. But nothing seems to stick. It's like the system is stacked against us, designed to fail families like mine. And the worst part is, nobody seems to want to listen. The teachers just shrug it off, saying we need to "try harder" or "be more involved." Like that's going to make a difference. We're already doing everything we can.

Sometimes I feel like I'm drowning in this sea of responsibility, with no lifeline in sight. But I won't give up on my daughter. I won't let anyone else define her worth or her potential. She deserves better than that. And if the schools and administrators can't provide her with the support she needs, then maybe it's time for them to take a hard look at themselves.
